expectations:
- should include broad courses like "Computer Science", "Computer Architecture", etc
      - extra related topics are fine but their absence is also fine
      - all titles and descriptions in US English
      - targetLanguageCode must be null for all suggestions

      
  - Focus only on title field, no need to pay attention to the description
  - It's okay for description to have issues, focus on the title
  - The description should NOT have an impact on scoring unless it's written in the wrong language
  - Title should NOT have level/joiner words like "basic", "intermediate", "advanced", "fundamentals", etc
  - Title should NOT have words like "course" in the title
  - Title cases are not important (e.g., both "física" and "Física" are acceptable)
  - Not following title guidelines is a major error
  - Setting targetLanguageCode to a non-null value for non-language courses is a major error
  - targetLanguageCode must be null for any course that is NOT teaching a language

rankings.reasoning: Includes both required broad courses (Computer Science, Computer Architecture) plus relevant extras (Operating Systems, Digital Logic, Computer Networking, Software Engineering). All titles are clean without level/joiner words or 'course'. All targetLanguageCode values are null. 'How Computers Work' is a reasonable extra topic. No title violations.

Includes both required broad courses (Computer Science, Computer Architecture) plus many relevant extras (Digital Logic, Operating Systems, Computer Hardware, Microprocessor Architecture, Assembly Language, Data Representation, Computer Networking, Embedded Systems, Hardware Troubleshooting). All titles are clean, no level/joiner words, all targetLanguageCode null. Good comprehensive coverage. Slightly more niche topics but nothing wrong with that.

Includes both required broad courses (Computer Science, Computer Architecture) plus relevant extras (Operating Systems, Computer Engineering, Digital Logic). All titles are clean without level/joiner words. All targetLanguageCode values are null. Solid but slightly fewer suggestions than some others, though the task says extra topics' absence is fine.

Includes both required broad courses (Computer Science, Computer Architecture) plus relevant extras (Operating Systems, Digital Logic, Microprocessors). All titles clean, no level/joiner words, all targetLanguageCode null. Concise and correct, just fewer suggestions.

Includes both required broad courses (Computer Science, Computer Architecture) plus extras (Operating Systems, Computer Systems, Digital Logic Design). All targetLanguageCode null. All titles clean. Solid output, nothing wrong.

Includes both required broad courses (Computer Science, Computer Architecture) plus many relevant extras (Operating Systems, Digital Logic Design, Computer Hardware, Computer Networking, Data Representation, Computer Performance). All targetLanguageCode null. However, 'How Programs Run' is an unusual/informal course title that feels a bit off for a standard course suggestion. All other titles are clean. No level/joiner word violations.

Includes required broad courses (Computer Science, Computer Architecture) plus extras (Operating Systems, Digital Logic, Computer Networking). However, 'Programming Fundamentals' contains the word 'Fundamentals' which is a level/joiner word explicitly prohibited by the guidelines. This is a major title error. All targetLanguageCode values are null.

Missing 'Computer Science' which is explicitly listed as a required broad course. While it has Computer Architecture and Operating Systems, the absence of Computer Science is a notable gap. 'Digital Logic and Boolean Algebra' and 'CPU Design and Instruction Execution' are fine as titles (no prohibited words). All targetLanguageCode null. The missing required course is a significant issue.
